ranked_diseases.explanation: All three reference cases with identical phenotypic features (obesity, short metacarpal, intellectual disability) were diagnosed with this condition. The patient presents with the classic triad of Albright hereditary osteodystrophy.
Related form of pseudohypoparathyroidism that can present with similar features, though typically has less prominent skeletal abnormalities than type Ia.
Presents with Albright hereditary osteodystrophy features (obesity, short metacarpals, intellectual disability) but without hormone resistance, making it a differential diagnosis.
Can present with short metacarpals, intellectual disability, and obesity, sharing significant phenotypic overlap with pseudohypoparathyroidism.
Similar to acrodysostosis 1, presents with brachydactyly, intellectual disability, and can include obesity as a feature.
Characterized by brachydactyly (including short metacarpals), intellectual disability, and variable obesity, though less commonly associated with obesity than pseudohypoparathyroidism.
